object.name: Device.FWE.
object.description: 5G Wireline wireless Encapsulation transport for data plane. See {{bibref|FWEREG}}.

parameter.name: LinkNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.FWE.Link.{i}.
object.description: 5G Wireline wireless Encapsulation link layer table (a stackable interface object as described in {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2}}).

parameter.name: Status
Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: The textual name of the link as assigned by the CPE.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description: The accumulated time in {{units}} since the link entered its current operational state.

parameter.name: LowerLayers
parameter.description: {{list}} {{reference|an interface object that is stacked immediately below this interface object}} See {{bibref|TR-181i2|Section 4.2.1}}.

object.name: Device.FWE.Link.{i}.Stats.
object.description:
Throughput statistics for this interface.
The CPE MUST reset the interface's Stats parameters (unless otherwise stated in individual object or parameter descriptions) either when the interface becomes operationally down due to a previous administrative down (i.e. the interface's {{param|#.Status}} parameter transitions to a down state after the interface is disabled). Operational interface status is discussed in {{bibref|TR-181i2|section 4.2.2}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of {{units}} received on the interface, including framing characters.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted out of the interface.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received on the interface.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets requested for transmission which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: UnicastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being transmitted. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: DiscardPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being delivered. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: MulticastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this layer.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets that higher-level protocols requested for transmission and which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer, including those that were discarded or not sent.

parameter.name: BroadcastPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of received packets, delivered by this layer to a higher layer, which were addressed to a broadcast address at this layer.

parameter.name: UnknownProtoPacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received via the interface which were discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
